bestBHT.bht: Acts 3:21 speaks of the heavens receiving Christ until the appointed time of the restitution of all things. The restitution mentioned here is not just a restoration of created beings to their original state but encompasses the fulfillment of promises and prophecies. This sense of restoration is confirmed by the fact that God has spoken through his holy prophets since the world began. The hope of Christ's return to bring about this restoration should comfort us in the midst of confusion, for God's word and the course of time itself affirm this truth.

bhtAttempts.bht: According to the commentators, Acts 3:21 speaks of the heavens receiving Christ until the appointed time of the restoration of all things. This restoration encompasses the rectification of the disorders caused by the fall and the fulfillment of the prophecies concerning Christ's work and the spread of the gospel. The term restitution used here indicates a complete restoration, like a dislocated joint being set back into its place. The fact that heaven must receive Christ until the times of restoration does not diminish the majesty of the Redeemer, as it aligns with the prophetic theme of the Old Testament and the hope for Christ's return. In the present age, when we see confusion in the world, this hope should provide us with comfort and assurance that Christ will come to restore all things.
